intro: Synthyris bullii, commonly known as the bull's thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, lobed leaves and a spiny stem. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Synthyris bullii is often found in dry, disturbed soils and can thrive in meadows and along roadsides.
